tool.name: RTModel
tool.description: Trains a model for the retention time prediction of peptides from a training set.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing #if $in: mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && #end if #if $in_positive: mkdir in_positive && ln -s '$in_positive' 'in_positive/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_positive.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_positive.ext)' && #end if #if $in_negative: mkdir in_negative && ln -s '$in_negative' 'in_negative/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_negative.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_negative.ext)' && #end if mkdir out && #if "out_oligo_params_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_oligo_params && #end if #if "out_oligo_trainset_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_oligo_trainset && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd #if $in: -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' #end if #if $in_positive: -in_positive 'in_positive/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_positive.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_positive.ext)' #end if #if $in_negative: -in_negative 'in_negative/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_negative.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_negative.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("txt")}' #if "out_oligo_params_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_oligo_params 'out_oligo_params/output.${gxy2omsext("paramxml")}' #end if #if "out_oligo_trainset_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_oligo_trainset 'out_oligo_trainset/output.${gxy2omsext("txt")}' #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("txt")}' '$out' #if "out_oligo_params_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_oligo_params/output.${gxy2omsext("paramxml")}' '$out_oligo_params' #end if #if "out_oligo_trainset_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_oligo_trainset/output.${gxy2omsext("txt")}' '$out_oligo_trainset' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: This is the name of the input file (RT prediction)
param.help: It is assumed that the file type is idXML. Alternatively you can provide a .txt file having a sequence and the corresponding rt per line.. select idxml,txt data sets(s)

param.label: input file with positive examples (peptide separation prediction)
input file with negative examples (peptide separation prediction)
the type of the svm (NU_SVR or EPSILON_SVR for RT prediction, automatically set
the nu parameter [0..1] of the svm (for nu-SVR)
the epsilon parameter of the svm (for epsilon-SVR)
the penalty parameter of the svm
the kernel type of the svm
the degree parameter of the kernel function of the svm (POLY kernel)
max standard deviation for a peptide to be included (if there are several ones for one peptide string)(median is taken)
the time (in seconds) of the gradient (only for RT prediction)
if set the model will be built for first_dim_rt
if the step sizes should be interpreted additively (otherwise the actual value is multiplied
param.help: with the step size to get the new value

section.name: cv
section.title: Parameters for the grid search / cross validation:

param.name: skip_cv
param.label: Set to enable Cross-Validation or set to true if the model should just be trained with 1 set of specified parameters

param.name: number_of_runs
param.label: number of runs for the CV (each run creates a new random partition of the data)
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs
param.option: out_oligo_params (output file with additional model parameters when using the OLIGO kernel)
out_oligo_trainset (output file with the used training dataset when using the OLIGO kernel)

data.name: out_oligo_params
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_oligo_params
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_oligo_params_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_oligo_trainset
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_oligo_trainset
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_oligo_trainset_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Trains a model for the retention time prediction of peptides from a training set.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.8.0/html/TOPP_RTModel.html
